comment.author: 9220365@N06
comment._content: I wonder if someone can identify the truck's manufacturer?

comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/cadillac_v16] The two trucks in the front appear to be White Motor Car trucks of the era. Also, possibly related to the "War auto for Russia" photos in this run of Bain photos, here is an article from the Chilton publication "The Automobile", Vol. XXXI, dated December 24, 1914 (Page 1178): 244 White Trucks Go To Russia Cleveland, O. - A train-load of seventy freight cars loaded with 244 motor trucks was shipped by the White Co., Saturday, destined for the Russian army; the equipment was made up of different truck capacities, the sale being made direct through the White dealer at Petrograd. This shipment is to go to New York, thence by steamer through the Panama Canal, and across the Pacific to Vladivostok, and thence over the Trans-Siberian railroad to Petrograd. . . books.google.com/books?id=mfUiAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA1178&...
